column5: I know there is not much use for a fish cradle for walleye. But with some of the large northern that we have caught while walleye fishing I was looking to maybe get a cradle. However, looking at some of the prices$$ they get for them I am thinking about making one. Doesn't seem like it would be too difficult...PVC, netting etc. Have any of you made your own? Tips/suggestions. Thanks.
I made one for muskies when I was in highschool (20 years ago). I used a couple of old hockey sticks for handles.
here is one the wife sewed up for me. It works. Later, Jay

Keep in mind that the fellow holding the cradle has two things being sort of pointed at his face - a very powerful fish with a mouthful of large hooks, and a person with a rod also being pointed pretty much directly at his face. Just sayin'.. Bill

As someone who uses a cradle all the time DO NOT buy or make one that's open at one or both ends. Both ends need to be closed. Anything else is a recipe for disaster and I speak from experience. Yes, the fish can back or slip out if the end is not closed.
Thanks for the great responses. After looking into it I'm going postpone making one and get the one that Bstar posted. I'm hoping it is good quality!
